Looks like a debug target with no VM is haning around. Do you have a VM that 
has not terminated properly?

Not that I was aware of...I didn't notice the walkbacks until 2 hours after 
they had occurred
*** Bug 28144 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
OK - this is happening to others. Now, if we only knew why... :-)

I had a zombie VM sticking around. I had started a debug run-time workbench. 
When I shut it down the debug view showed the Main thread with (may be out of 
sync) and a few stack frames labeled <not responding>. I saw the same yesterday.
I'm using J9.

Fixed in JavaBreakpoint. This happens when a target disconnects, rather than 
terminates. We were trying to recreate breakpoints in disconnected targets 
(only checking if the target was terminated, rather than terminated || 
disconnected).
*** Bug 28506 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Build: I20030115
java.vm.info=J2RE 1.3.1 IBM Windows 32 build cn131-20020403 (JIT enabled: jitc)

I still have the same problem using build I20030115. When I have any terminated 
debug sessions in the Debug view, I can't change a breakpoint's properties.

Only if I remove all terminated launches in the Debug view, I can confirm a 
breakpoint properties change.

Please reopen.

Same problem as bug 29617.
